doc.title: SAIC Motor (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/SAIC Motor A Shangjie volume salesvaluation accretion lift PO to RMB27 upgrade to BuySAIC Motor A Shangjie volume salesv_2025-08-29

passages.text: Rating Change: BUY | PO: 27.00 CNY | Price: 18.93 CNY

We upgrade SAIC from Underperform to Buy, given (1) we expect Shangjie, the new EV brand jointly developed by Huawei and SAIC Motor, to become a popular brand and contribute strong volume sales; (2) SAIC VW, SAIC GM sales volume is likely to stabilize in 2026 amid anti- involution environment. We raise our 2025/26/27E volume sales by \(1\% /5\% /10\%\) , mainly to reflect stronger sales from Shangjie. We change our valuation method from average of DCF and P/E to SOTP to better capture the value of Shangjie: (1) we apply 0.7x P/B (historical average) to 2026E BVPS for SAIC's legacy business to reflect the value of its assets; (2) we apply 1.3x P/S for Shangjie's 2026E sales to factor in the fast- growing revenue contribution. Our new PO is RMB27 (was RMB15.3).

Shangjie is positioned as a mass- market EV brand jointly developed by Huawei and SAIC Motor. On 25 August, SAIC unveiled Shangjie H5 SUV, with pre- sale prices of RMB169.8- 209.8k. H5 is the most budget- friendly model under HIMA alliance but deploys Huawei's ADS 4 advanced driving assistance system. H5 booked over 50k units refundable orders in one day after starting pre- sales. Shangjie is likely to launch two new models in 2026. Accordingly, we expect SAIC Shangjie to post 60k/260k/550k units volume sales in 2025/26/27E, respectively. H5's official launch is scheduled on 23 September.

We expect to see some supportive policies in ICEV amid anti- involution environment in 2026, since ICEV companies are still key contributors in employment/tax in China. We forecast VW and GM will see stable (flat YoY or mild decline) volume sales in 2026, partially on higher EV purchase tax and a likely lower EV purchase subsidy. With stable volume sales and being not loss making, the market may value SAIC's legacy business (VW, GM, own brands) via the book value, which reflects the value of SAIC, in our view. SAIC posted 2Q25 earnings of RMB3.0bn, down \(23\%\) YoY on a high base, while beating our previous estimates on higher foreign exchange gain and fair value gain. We have changed the income rating from same/lower (8) to same/higher (7) as we expect the dividend payout to increase over the next year.

Autos/Car Manufacturers

SAlC Motor is China's leading auto- maker, with sales volume of over 4mn vehicles in 2024. SAIC markets its own passenger and commercial vehicle brands such as Roewe, MG, Iveco, and also has joint ventures with General Motors and Volkswagen. SAIC was listed on the Shanghai Stock exchange in 1997.

We have a Buy rating on SAIC as: 1) we expect Shangjie, the new EV brand jointly developed by Huawei and SAIC Motor, to become a popular brand and contribute strong volume sales, (2) SAIC VW, SAIC GM sales volume likely to stabilize in 2026 amid anti- involution environment.

On 25 August, SAIC unveiled Shangjie H5, a mid- sized SUV, with pre- sale prices at RMB169.8- 209.8k. H5 is the most budget- friendly model under HIDA alliance but will be also equipped with Huawei's ADS 4 advanced driving assistance system. H5 booked over 50k units refundable orders in one day after starting pre- sales. H5's official launch is scheduled on 23 September.

Strong model pipelines; expect 60k/260k/250k volume sales in 2025/26/27E Shangjie brand is expected to launch two new models, one sedan and one SUV in 2026, according to media report. Accordingly, we expect SAIC Shangjie to post 60k/260k/550k units volume sales in 2025/26/27E, respectively.

For Shangjie, media reported that a dedicated factory has been built in Lingang, Shanghai; meanwhile, part of production lines at SAIC- GM's factory in Jinqiao, Shanghai, might be reallocated to SAIC. According to media report, SAIC has released a component procurement plan for 400k units annually to its supply chain.

Regarding sales channels, Shangjie is reported to be sold at both HIMA's user centers and dedicated Shangjie user centers. Shangjie is recruiting dealers to expand its sales network channel layout. Shangjie earlier mentioned that it has received applications from over 1,500 dealers, including 4S stores switching from luxury brands such as Porsche, Volvo, and Lotus. For instance, Yongda (China's \(2^{\text{nd}}\) largest dealer) has 6 Shangjie sales points, and have another 10 sales point authorization on hand.

We believe Shangjie, as a mass- market EV brand jointly developed by Huawei and SAIC Motor, could replicate the success of AITO. AITO, a premium Chinese EV brand jointly developed by Seres and Huawei, was a hit in the China EV market. In 2023, AITO launched the new M7 and M9, which were highly recognized by customers for smart driving, smart functions, safety, comfort, and space. In 2024, AITO brand secured 3.5% share in China EV market. The success was built on Huawei's leading ADAS & smart cabin solutions which offers first- class experience, while Seres also put dedicated efforts in vehicle production and sales.
Exhibit 1: AITO's monthly sales trend from December 2021 to July 2025

**Shangjie (Huawei/SAIC cooperation):** **mass-market** brand priced below RMB200kShangjie is positioned as a mass-market brand priced below RMB200k. The first model,H5, a mid-sized SUV, with pre-sale prices at RMB169.8-209.8k, was launched in August 2025. H5 is the most budget-friendly model under HIMA alliance but will be also equipped with Huawei's ADS 4 advanced driving assistance system. H5 competes with BYD Song Plus, Leapmotor C11, XPeng G6.

**Maextro (Huawei/JAC cooperation): ultra-high-end brand priced above RMB700k**Maextro brand is positioned at ultra-high-end and priced at >RMB700k level. The Maextro brand is expected to compete with ultra-luxury brands such as Maybach and Rolls-Royce. The first model, S800, a large-size BEV/EREV sedan, was launched in May 2025. S800 competes with Benz S class, BMW 7 series, Audi A8.

**Stelato (Huawei/BAIC cooperation): premium brand in RMB300-500k segment**Stelato's products cover RMB300-500k EREV/BEV SUV/Sedan. **Stelato S9,** a mid-/large-size sedan, was launched with BEV version in Aug-2024; an EREV version of S9 was launched in 2025. Stelato S9 competes with Denza Z9 GT, NIO ET5T, BMW 5 series,Audi A6L.

**Luxeed (Huawei/Chery cooperation): high-end brand in RMB200-350k segment**Luxeed's products cover RMB200-350k EREV/BEV SUV/sedan. **Luxeed S7,** a mid-/large-size BEV sedan, was firstly introduced in Nov-2023 and facelifted in 2024/ 2025. The model competes with Xiaomi SU7, BYD Han L, Tesla Model 3. **Luxeed R7,** a hatchback mid-to-large SUV, was launched with BEV version in Sept-2024, and followed by EREV version in Dec-2024. The model competes with Tesla Model Y, BYD Tang, Xiaomi YU7.
**AITO (Huawei/Seres cooperation): premium brand in RMB200-600k segment**

AITO's products cover RMB200-600k EREV/BEV SUV. AITO has four existing models (1)AITO M9 (flagship full-sized SUV, offering EREV and BEV versions, also available in five-seat and six-seat version); (2) AITO M8 (large-size five-seat/six-seat EREV/BEV SUV); (3)AITO M7 (mid-/large-size five-seat/six-seat EREV SUV); (4) AITO M5 (five-seat BEV/EREV SUV). AITO's products compete with Li Auto L6/L7/L8/L9/i8, Tesla Model Y,and also Mercedes/BMW/Audi.

The cooperation between Huawei and OEMs can be categorized into three types: auto part/hardware supplier, Huawei Inside solution, Huawei Smart Selection (HIMA alliance). We expect the five Huawei Smart Selection (HIMA alliance) brands to continue to constitute the core volume sales of cars empowered by Huawei, thanks to Huawei's deep involvement in vehicle/system design and Huawei's strong sales and service networks.

SAIC reported 2Q25 results on 28 August: sales came in at RMB159bn, up 12% YoY.

SAIC posted equity income from JV and associates of RMB1.1bn vs. RMB4mn in 2Q24.2Q25 earnings came in at RMB3.0bn, down 23% YoY on a high base (as SAIC booked RMB5.1bn disposal gains from MG Motor India in 2Q24), while beating our previous estimates on foreign exchange gains and fair value revaluation gain. If adjusted for one-off items (mainly government subsidy), PAT would be RMB2.6bn vs. net loss of
Exhibit 5: P&L summary (quarterly)
SAIC's 2Q net income was down 23% YoY at RMB3.0bn
Source: Company report

Factoring in 2Q25 result, the latest sales volume of legacy brands, and sales expectation on Shangjie, we lift 2025/26/27E sales volume by 1%/5%/10%. Accordingly, we raise 2025/26/27E revenue by 3%/8%/14%. But, we lower 2025/26/27E GM by 0.5ppt/1.3ppt/2.2ppt to reflect latest product mix - Shangjie may drag GPM at the initial ramp-up stage. Net-net, we raise 2025/26/27E net income by 43%/23%/34%.
Exhibit 6:SAIC's new vs.old estimates We raise 2025/26/27E net income by \(43\% /23\% /34\%\)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates

We change our valuation methodology from an average of P/E and DCF to SOTP to separately value SAIC Group, excluding Shangjie and Shangjie brand. We see this can better capture the strong sales volume growth of Shangjie brand and hence the premium valuation, while SAIC Group excluding Shangjie (like VW, GM, SAIC ICEV cars etc) is expected to deliver more stable sales/earnings in 2026- 27E. Our new PO is RMB27 (was RMB15.2), which implies 1.1x 2025 P/B and 1.0x 2026 P/B.

SAIC Group (excluding Shangjie): we apply \(0.7x\) P/B to 2026E BVPS for SAIC Group (excluding Shangjie). Our target PBR is based on the stock's historical 5- year average one- year forward PBR (0.7x).

Shangjie brand: we apply \(1.3x\) P/S to its 2026E sales. Our target P/S ratio is benchmarking Seres' historical average P/S (since 2021, when Seres started the collaboration with Huawei to launch AITO brand), as both Shangjie and AITO are cooperating with Huawei and have the same business model (Huawei Smart Selection). We expect Shangjie to have a high likelihood to be successful, as Seres' AITO brand has become, leveraging Huawei's brand power and technology.
Exhibit 7:SAIC's SOTP valuation Our derived PO is RMB27

We derive our PO of RMB27 based on the SOTP methodology.
SAIC Group (excluding Shangjie): we apply \(0.7xP / B\) to 2026E BVPS for SAIC Group (excl. Shangjie). Our target PBR is based on the stock's historical 5- year average one- year forward PBR (0.7x).
Shangjie brand: we apply 1.3x P/S to its 2026E sales. Our target P/S ratio is referenced to our implied target multiple of its A Share EV brand Seres (1.3x 2026E).

Downside risks: Slowdown in macro and industry growth, intensified pricing competition from peers, slower product launch, lesser- than- expected improvement in SAIC PV's earnings, faster share lose to local brands.
Upside risks: Stronger sales in SAIC VW and SAIC GM.
